result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler R. Monroe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler R. Monroe

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco and Jessica Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments by Bayne-Allison - State is requesting a time served sentence - 829 days credit due on this case - Arguments by Nocco - Court sentences defendant to 1 year jail with credit for 829 days served - Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations $518.00  - Statements regarding revocation summary -  Post conviction rights given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 7, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody by video with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco and Jessica Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Court has requested this hearing.  Discussion on the record as to the status of the deft's probation.  Parties would like to have this hearing set for another day after counsel has time to review the new case.  Court suggest to set a scheduling conference about one month out.  All parties agree.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.
and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing, and Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations
Status conference on March 6, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody via video with attorney Jessica Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin and is here as an officer of the court -  Statements by Bayne-Allison - Response by Schuster - States defendant was to be released as he was cleared after being assessed - Schuster states defendant should be released immediately - Statements regarding new charges being filed - Anticipated defendant will appear on new charges Monday 2/27/17 - Schuster states defendant was illegally detained - Bayne-Allison concerned that Ms. Bergstrom was not properly noticed for today's hearing - Court will leave it up to Lincoln County jail and Northcentral Health care  as to residence of defendant

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco and Attorney Jessica Schuster -  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Oral arguments and ruling - Arguments by Bayne-Allison - Arguments by Nocco - Rebuttal by Bayne-Allison - Court finds both Doctors are qualified - Court finds the state has not met their burden of proof - Court finds the defendant may be likely to become competent - Court will suspend proceeding - Defendant committed to DHS - Arguments by Nocco regarding time limits and release - defendant has been in custody for 588 days - Arguments by Bayne-Allison - Request defendant be committed under 971.14(6)(b) - Response by Nocco - Court reviews statute - Court finds the 12 month period has expired and court will proceed under subsection 6 - Discharged from committment - under (6)(b) - Defendant to be taken immediately to treatment facility by law enforcement - Statements by Bayne-Allison/Nocco -  Suggestion than rather than treating this as a new chapter 51 proceeding, we treat this as a move to a more restrictive placement in  the chapter 51 proceeding.  He would be entitled to a hearing to review that change. -

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody with attorney Alec Nocco and Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Elliot Lee contacted via phone - Sworn - Direct by Bayne-Allison - Objection by Nocco - Response by Bayne-Allison - Court overrules objections - Dr. Lees report moved into evidence and court receives - Cross by Nocco - Redirect by Bayne-Allison - Follow up by Nocco - Exhibit #1 marked - Dr. Catherine Bard called - Sworn - Direct by Schuster - Exhibit #1 offered and received - Cross by Bayne-Allison - Redirect by Schuster - Dr. Bard's report received by court - Recross - Objections - Redirect by Bayne-Allison as to Dr. Lee - Doctors are are required for next hearing  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler R. Monroe
Current: 1104 E 1st St, Merrill, WI 54452 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2017)
Prior: 507 1/2 Wisconsin Street, Merrill, WI 54452
Competency hearing on February 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster & attorney Alec Nocco in person.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by State - Statements by Court - Arguments by Nocco - Arguments by Bayne-Allison - State requests an additional examination be done - Arguments regarding physician being appointed - Court will appoint an examiner either Dr. Galli or another Dr. available to conduct examination -  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 10:00 am.
State's To Permit Telephone Testimony -  Granted by court
Competency hearing on January 11, 2017 at 10:00 am.
State of Wisconsin/Division of Hearings and Appeals
#1 - report of Dr Lundbohm MOR  _ Court orders that the report is to be sealed.

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody with attorney Jessica L Schuster. Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  All parties have received the report from doctor.  The defense is going to request a second evaluation.  Defense addresses the court in regards to the 2nd evaluation.  State opposes the request of a second evaluation.  State addresses the court as to the request.  Arugements heard.  Court addresses the parties.  Court will adjourn this hearing if defense wants another evalution but it would be at the expense of the defense not the court.  Defense takes a moment to discuss and has decided to proceed at this time.  Dr. Brooke Lundbohm duly sworn and testifies by phone.  Cross by defense, redirect from the State.   Defense has cross on the redirect.  Parties rest.  Arguements heard from State and Defense.  Court rules to that the deft is competent to proceed on this case.  Court finds that the deft is competent.  The suspension on this case is lifted.  The revocation hearing would be the next step.  The deft is to be held in Lincoln County Jail until that hearing.
Competency hearing on July 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Consent is revoked for any release form signed by Tyler Monroe between 1/13/16 and 3/24/16 for any person or agency other than his attorneys.

Attorneys Jessica L Schuster and Alec Nocco in court, defendant Tyler R. Monroe not in court, in custody and appears by video.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Two motions to be heard. Dunphy stipulates to entry of competency report and Order to transport Deft to Mendota or Winnebago and Order of involuntary medication. Court reviews report by Dr. Gali. Finding of incompetency. Court finds that Deft is incompetent. Court orders Deft to be transported to either Winnebago or Mendota. Court also orders the administratiion of medication(s) as prescibed with or without consent by Deft.  Re: State does not object to preservation of video evidence. Court orders that all audio or visual recordings obtained on or after February 15th , 2016, be preserved. Order to be sent to Jail and Sheriff's Department. Court signs order. Nocco heard on second motion to revoke medical release. Argues that release should not have been obtained without consultation with attorney(s). Dunphy objects to order 1-6 as Deft has right to withdraw consent. Information received before withdrawal of consent; Sheriff's Department has right to preserve and distribute. Argues 5th and 6th amendment rights and remedies. Requests that a blanket ruling not be entered prohibiting LE from accessing information from Deft, specifically medical information, as it relates to Deft.  1-6 addressed. Copy of Invocation of Rights provided by Atty Nocco. Court orders revocation of consent as of 3/24/2016 but not prior to.
To Prohibit Further Law Enforcement Contact
from State of Wisconsin/Division of Hearings and Appeals

records.addlTxt: Notice to offender - New probation case - (filed in 13CF298)

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF50 & 14CF153 also being called -  Plea no contest to count 1 as amended 3rd degree - Deferred agreement in count 1 in 13CF298 for 24 months - Plea no contest to counts 2 & 3 in 13CF298 and no contest to count 3 in 14CF153 - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court of counts 2 & 3 in 13CF298 and found guilty of count 3 in 14CF153 -  Arguments by Dunphy/Wolff/State to sentencing - 14CF153 & 13CF298 Sentence withheld - 2 years probation each count concurrent - CC/Surcharges - 180 days jail on count 3 in 14CF153 & on counts 2 & 3 concurrent with huber- No contact with females under 18 unless victim & probation agent agree- Sexual offender evaluation -  Defendant may petition for expungement in 14CF153 count 3 upon successful completion of probation and payment of all costs/surcharges - Credit for 70 days if revoked in 14CF153  - Post conviction rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew Wade called - Sworn - Direct by Dunphy - Defendant identified by witness - Cross by Wolff - Arguments by Dunphy - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt of information - Waive reading - Plea not guilty -  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 10:35 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tyler R. Monroe in court, in custody via video with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1:34pm - In receipt of complaint - Wolff appears specially for today's hearing - Waive reading - Statements by Wolff regarding 14CF50, 13CF298 - Motion withdraw compt. motion in these cases - Zengler requests cash bond - Other matters will track this case  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
